sub_topic: Determining the length of a side in an equilateral triangle.
message_1: A student is trying to find the length of a side in an equilateral triangle with a perimeter of 48 cm. What is the length, in centimeters, of one side of the equilateral triangle?
message_2:
An equilateral triangle has three equal sides. To find the length of one side, we can divide the perimeter by the number of sides.

Length of one side = Perimeter / Number of sides
Length of one side = 48 cm / 3
Length of one side = 16 cm

The length of one side of the equilateral triangle is 16 cm.
